intro: Petroselinum segetum, commonly known as turnip parsley, is a biennial plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers cool, moist climates. Its roots are usually small and less developed compared to other members of the parsley family. It is often cultivated as a leafy vegetable and used in culinary applications.
